text: William Gibbins (1872–1956) is a former Chairman of Everton. He presided over the club between 1940 and 1947, and was on the Board from 1920 to 1953. He was also actively involved with the Liverpool County Football Association. He died at his home in Bootle on 22 September 1956.Liverpool Echo 22 September 1956 He is credited with introducing baseball to Goodison Park. ==References== Category:1872 births Category:1956 deaths Category:English football chairmen and investors Category:Everton F.C. directors and chairmen Category:People from Bootle
title: Bill Gibbins
